title: Installation issue: gcc@8.2.0
body:
This is not building with a vanilla install on RHEL7.5 for some reason:

[spack-build.out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/2383752/spack-build.out.txt)

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```
$ spack install gcc@8.2.0 
# Error:
     21537    /bin/sh ./libtool  --tag=CC   --mode=compile /tmp/pk7/spack-stage/spack-stage-DwBCso/gcc-8.2.0/spack-build/./gcc/xgcc -B/tmp/pk7/spack-stage/spack-stage-DwBCso/gcc-8.2.0/spack-build/./gcc/ -B/home/pk7/apps/sp
              ack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/bin/ -B/home/pk7/apps/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhy
              vbb5jsh/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/lib/ -isystem /home/pk7/apps/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/include -isystem /home/pk7/apps/spack/opt/s
              pack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/sys-include    -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvb
              b5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran  -iquote/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/io -I/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c6
              5kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/../gcc -I/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/../gcc/config -I/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2
              .0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/../libquadmath -I../.././gcc -I/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/../libgcc -I../li
              bgcc -I/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/../libbacktrace -I../libbacktrace -I../libbacktrace  -std=gnu11 -Wall -Wstrict-prototypes -Wmissing
              -prototypes -Wold-style-definition -Wextra -Wwrite-strings -Werror=implicit-function-declaration -Werror=vla  -fcx-fortran-rules -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections   -g -O2 -MT any_l4.lo -MD -MP -MF .deps/an
              y_l4.Tpo -c -o any_l4.lo `test -f '/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/generated/any_l4.c' || echo '/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8
              .2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/'`/home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/generated/any_l4.c
     21538    In file included from ./kinds.h:75,
     21539                     from /home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/libgfortran.h:238,
     21540                     from /home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/runtime/string.c:25:
  >> 21541    /home/pk7/apps/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-8.2.0-hgk7wfgok3k44gj3c65kylnhyvbb5jsh/gcc-8.2.0/libgfortran/kinds-override.h:40:5: error: #error "Where has __float128 gone?"
     21542     #   error "Where has __float128 gone?"
     21543         ^~~~~
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```
>uname -a
Linux oxygen.ornl.gov 3.10.0-862.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Mar 21 18:14:51 EDT 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
>lsb_release -d
Description:	Red Hat Enterprise Linux Workstation release 7.5 (Maipo)
``` 

Custom packages.yaml required to use system perl to work around compilation problems with perl. 

```
packages:
  perl:
    paths:
      perl @5.16.3: /
```


### Additional information

This is a completely fresh install of spack. Fresh clone, bootstrap, no custom configuration besides packages.yaml perl workaround. Some ~half year ago spack installed gcc without trouble on this system, albeit with presumable earlier versions of all dependencies including spack. We are using the system installed gcc 4.8.5 compiler. 

Disabling fortran works, i.e. spack install gcc languages=c,c++
